intro: Hylodesmum laxum subsp. laxum, commonly known as the narrowleaf hylodesmum, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cucurbitaceae. It is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, opposite leaves that are typically lanceolate in shape. The plant produces yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, and its fruits are elongated, cylindrical berries. It is native to certain regions of South America and thrives in humid, tropical environments. This subspecies is often found in shaded, moist habitats such as forest understories.
